name: IPAddressScanner
description: Scans the IP Addresses that your users have used to access a VSTS account, and compares them against a list of known/allowable addresses and/or ranges.
author: Swellaby

inputs.name: accountName
inputs.label: VSTS Account Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of your VSTS account (the part that comes before the '.visualstudio.com' in the URL).

inputs.name: accessToken
inputs.label: Personal Access Token
inputs.helpMarkDown: A personal Access Token (PAT) that has access to make REST API calls to the specified VSTS Account.

inputs.name: ipRange
inputs.label: Allowed IP Address/CIDR Blocks (IPV4)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The valid/allowed IP Addresses and/or ranges (CIDR Blocks) of IP Addresses. Enter each block on its own line.

inputs.name: timePeriod
inputs.label: Time Period
inputs.helpMarkDown: Controls which time period of activity will be scanned (UTC Standard).

inputs.name: userOrigin
inputs.label: User Origin
inputs.helpMarkDown: Controls which set of users will have their traffic scanned. Specifying Azure Active Directory means the scanner will only scan traffic from user accounts that come from your AAD tenant. 'All' will result in scanning the traffic for every single user identity that has access to your VSTS acount, which includes several internal/non-user VSTS accounts.

inputs.name: scanInternalVstsServices
inputs.label: Include Internal VSTS Activity?
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies whether or not the scan should include activity records that were created by internal VSTS services. This should almost always be set to false
